thread.title: Recreation Calendar: Sept. 28-Oct. 11

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Recreation Calendar: Sept. 28-Oct. 11
text:
Biking Breast Cancer Awareness Bike Ride and Run: Featuring 10, 25 and 50 mile family-friendly bike routes. Also, 5K Fun Run and a one-mile nature walk. Benefits the Breast Cancer Research Foundation, Wilmot Cancer Center and Breast Cancer Coalition of Rochester. 7 p.m. Oct. 11. Stewart Lodge, Mendon Ponds Park, Clover Street, Pittsford. (585) 381-2808 or www.towpathbike.com/events/breast-cancer-awareness-ride-pg114.htm.
Dance
Afternoon Social Dance: Dance to recorded music. 2 to 3:30 p.m. Oct. 1. St. Thomas Episcopal Church, 2000 Highland Ave. at South Winton Road. $4. (585) 721-8684 or www.estherbrillpartnerdance.com.
Country Line Dance Lessons: 7:30-9:30 p.m. Monday and Wednesday; 7:30-9 p.m. Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday. Nashville’s, 4853 West Henrietta Road, Henrietta. $5. (585) 334-3030 or www.nashvilleny.com.
October Showcase and Dance Party: 6 to 11 p.m. Oct. 3. Inikori Dance Studio, 1060 University Ave. (near Culver Road). $13; $10 ages 6 to 15; free ages 5 and younger. (585) 271-6840 or www.inikoridance.com.
Tea Dance: Ballroom, Waltz, Cha-Cha, swing and other styles. Sponsored by Mo Dancing. 1 to 4 p.m. Oct. 4. German House, 315 Gregory St. $10. (585) 944-9641 or www.modancing.com.
Youth Cultural Dance Night: Guests will have the opportunity to see and learn cultural dances from Latin American countries. 6 to 8 p.m. Oct. 2. Thomas P. Ryan Community Center, 530 Webster Ave. (585) 428-7149 or www.hispanicheritagemonth@cityofrochester.gov.
Fishing
Fish Hatchery at Powder Mills Park: Operated by the Riedman Foundation. Open 7 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Monday through Friday; 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Saturday and Sunday. Fish Hatchery at Powder Mills Park, 116 Park Road at Corduroy Road, Perinton. Free admission. (585) 586-1670 or www.fishpowdermill.org.
Hockey
AHL Hockey: Rochester Americans vs. Binghamton Senators: 7:05 p.m. Oct. 1. Gene Polisseni Center at Rochester Institute of Technology, 200 Lomb Memorial Drive, Henrietta. $5; $3 RIT students; free to RIT season ticket holders. (585) 475-4121, (585) 454-5335 or www.amerks.com.
AHL Hockey: Rochester Americans vs. Lake Erie Monsters: 7:05 p.m. Oct. 9. Blue Cross Arena at the War Memorial, One War Memorial Square. $14-$27. (585) 454-5335 or www.amerks.com.
AHL Hockey: Rochester Americans vs. Utica Comets: 7:35 p.m. Oct. 10. Blue Cross Arena at the War Memorial, One War Memorial Square. $14-$27. (585) 454-5335 or www.amerks.com.
Nature Study
Durand Eastman Park Arboretum Tours: Tours will be conducted by community volunteers. They will last two hours and traverse moderate hills and wooded trails. Meet at the kiosk on Zoo Road, next to the park offices lot. 2 to 4 p.m. Oct. 4 and 11. Durand Eastman Park, Lakeshore Boulevard, Irondequoit. Free; donations accepted. (585) 261-1665.
Enchanted Forest: An evening walk through magical woods. Led by costumed interpreters. Activities include a raffle, storytelling, games, crafts and snacks. 6 to 8:30 p.m. Oct. 9 to 11. Beaver Meadow Nature Center, 1610 Welch Road, North Java. $8; free to ages 3 and younger. (585) 457-3228 or info@buffaloaudubon.org.
Falling Leaves: Discover why trees lose their leaves in the autumn and explore how animals prepare for winter. 10 a.m. to noon Oct. 10. Cumming Nature Center, Rochester Museum & Science Center, 6472 Gulick Road, South Bristol. Suggestd donation $3; family $10. (585) 374-6160 or www.rmsc.org.
The Bird House Photography Contest: Enter photographs of birds, wildlife or scenery. There is a limit of two 8x10 unframed prints submissions per person. Prizes will be awarded. Visit the website for more information. Through Oct. 2. The Bird House, 3035 Monroe Ave., Pittsford. Free. (585) 264-1550 or www.thebirdhouseny.com.
The History of Highland and Durand-Eastman Parks: Beverly Gibson will detail the history of these parks and their plantings. Meet in the Briarwood Building. 7:30 p.m. Oct. 9. St. John’s Meadows, 1 Johnsarbor Drive, Brighton. www.bancny.org/.
Wild Wings Sanctuary: A birds of prey sanctuary located in Mendon Ponds Park. Stroll through the outdoor facility, observe resident raptors and visit the gift cottage. 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. daily (closed Wednesdays and Thursdays). Wild Wings Sanctuary, 27 Pond Road (off Route 65), Mendon. Free; donations accepted. (585) 334-7790 or www.wildwingsinc.org.
Wildflower Hike: 10 a.m. to noon Oct. 3. Cumming Nature Center, Rochester Museum & Science Center, 6472 Gulick Road, South Bristol. Suggested donation $3; family $10. (585) 374-6160 or www.rmsc.org.
Other
Certified Laughter Yoga Leader Training: Joellen Kuhl, leader; Dale Heffer, assistant. 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Oct. 3 and 4. Legacy at Cranberry Landing, 300 Cranberry Landing Drive, Irondequoit. $295. (585) 797-3474 or www.laughrochester.com.
Day Trip to Bethel Woods Center for the Performing Arts: The Bethel Woods Center is located at the site of the 1969 Woodstock Festival. The museum provides a multi-media experience of film, music, interactive displays, artifacts and personal narratives to tell the story of the Woodstock Festival. The package includes transportation, a guided tour of the grounds, admission to the museum and a boxed lunch. Sponsored by the Geneva Historical Society. Oct. 9. Geneva Historical Society Museum at the Prouty-Chew House, 543 S. Main St., Geneva. $75. (315) 789-5151.
Rochester Bocce Open: 10 a.m. Oct. 3. Italian American Community Center, 150 Frank Dimino Way, Gates. $200 per two man team (includes lunch). (585) 831-0448.
Tours of the Mount Hope Cemetery, North Section: Subjects covered include local history, horticulture, geology, architecture, symbolism and more. 2 to 4 p.m. Oct. 4 and 11. North Gate House at Mount Hope Cemetery, 791 Mt. Hope Ave. $5; free for children younger than 16 when accompanied by an adult. (585) 461-3494 or www.fomh.org.
Running/Walking
5K Walk for Water for South Sudan: 9:30 a.m. to noon Oct. 3. Monroe Community College, 1000 East Henrietta Road, Brighton. $7; $5 advance. (585) 292-3321 or www.monroecc.edu/depts/holocaust/programs/walkrun-for-water/.
Fleet Feet Half or Full Marathon Training Program Information Session: This program will help runners and walkers train successfully and safely. 7 p.m. Oct. 1. Fleet Feet Sports at the Armory, 155 Culver Road, Suite 110. (585) 697-3338 or www.fleetfeetrochester.com.
Fleet Feet Half or Full Marathon Training Program Information Session: This program will help runners and walkers train successfully and safely. 7:15 p.m. Sept. 30. Fleet Feet Sports Greece, 2522 Ridgeway Ave., Greece. (585) 270-4334 or www.fleetfeetrochester.com.
George Eastman House Photo Finish 5K: This unusual philanthropy event allows multiple organizations to raise funds through a single event. Individuals or teams can sign-up on behalf of their favorite non-profit organization. The course travels through the Neighborhood of the Arts. Bicycles, skateboards, pets and strollers are not permitted. Oct. 3. George Eastman House, 900 East Ave. $35; $25 through Aug. 23; $30 Aug. 24 through Sept. 30. (585) 271-3361 or http://photofinish5K.eastmanhouse.org.
Monroe Community College Foundation 5K Walk and Run for Scholarships : 9:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. Oct. 10. Monroe Community College, 1000 East Henrietta Road, Brighton. $23; $18 before Oct. 6; $10 MCC students; free to ages 10 and younger. (585) 262-1500 or www.monroecc.edu/depts/foundation/alumni/5k.htm.
Montezuma Aqueduct 5K Run and Walk: Also, kids’ fun run. 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. Oct. 10. Montezuma Heritage Park, Montezuma. (315) 776-4656 or www.montezumarun.com.
Penfield Walk: 90 minutes. Sponsored by Huggers Ski Club/Pacesetters Walking Group. 6:30 p.m. Oct. 6. Parking lot next to Upper Crust Cakery, Five Mile Line Road, Penfield. (585) 249-9507.
Rochester NF Walk: Benefits neurofibromatosis research. 10 a.m. Oct. 3; registration 8:30 a.m.. Perinton Park, Route 31F at O’Connor Road, Perinton. www.nfwalk.org/rochester.
Step Up for Kids 5K Run/Walk: Benefits the Child Advocacy Center of the Finger Lakes. 5K begins 9 a.m. Oct. 11; Family Fun Run 10 a.m.; registration 7:45 a.m.. Registration required. Finger Lakes Community College, 3325 Marvin Sands Drive, Hopewell. (315) 548-3232 or www.runsignup.com/race/ny/canandaigua/stepupforkids.
Train for the Fight for Air Climb: Practice climbs enable registrants and non-registrants alike to see what it is like to climb the 20 flights (400 stairs) of Legacy Tower. (The Fight for Air Climb will take place on Oct. 17). 9:30 to 11:30 a.m. Oct. 3. Legacy Tower, One Bausch & Lomb Place. www.fightforairclimb.org.
UnCaged Brigade 5K: noon to 3 p.m. Oct. 3. Custom Brewcrafters, 300 Village Square Blvd., Honeoye Falls. $90; $80 advance. (323) 762-5530 or www.cbcraftbrewers.com/.
Walk for Parkinson’s Disease: This event will also include a Movement Pavilion featuring various types of exercise such as yoga, Tai Chi, dance and entertainment for children. 10 a.m. Oct. 4; registration begins 8:30 a.m.. Monroe Community College, 1000 East Henrietta Road, Brighton. (585) 234-5355 or www.movingdayrochester.org.
